articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian officials threatened the West on Saturday with an uncontrolled escalation of war and Ukraine with the destruction of Kyiv as Western leaders discussed whether to allow Ukraine to use their weapons for strikes deep into Russian territory.
articles.title: Russia threatens Ukraine, West as long-range strikes decision looms

articles.author: Marco Aquino
articles.title: As Peru buries Fujimori, a complex tussle over his legacy

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hundreds of people waving Turkish and Palestinian flags gathered for the funeral on Saturday for Aysenur Ezgi Eygi, a Turkish-American activist killed in the Israeli-occupied West Bank.
articles.title: Funeral held for Turkish-American activist killed in West Bank

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Italian prosecutor on Saturday asked a judge to sentence right-wing League leader Matteo Salvini to six years in prison over his 2019 decision to prevent more than 100 migrants from landing in the country.
articles.title: Italy's prosecutor seeks 6-year jail sentence for Salvini on migrant kidnapping charges

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United Arab Emirates does not expect to resume talks with the U.S. about a multi-billion dollar deal for F-35 warplanes, irrespective of who is elected to the White House in November, a senior UAE government official said on Saturday.
articles.title: UAE does not plan to re-open F-35 fighter jet talks with US

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hundreds of people, mostly women, gathered in cities around France on Saturday in support of Gisele Pelicot, a woman whose husband is on trial, accused of drugging her and recruiting dozens of strangers to rape her over nearly a decade in a case that has shocked the nation.
articles.title: Hundreds gather in France in support of Giselle Pelicot and all rape victims

articles.author: Amanda Perobelli, Anthony Boadle
articles.description: Brazil has almost squashed the illegal gold rush that led thousands of wildcat miners into the Yanomami reservation in the Amazon rainforest and caused a humanitarian crisis of disease and malnutrition, the man in charge of operations said.
articles.title: Brazil says it has nearly cleared gold miners from Amazon Yanomami reservation

articles.author: Ammu Kannampilly
articles.description: On the morning of Sunday Sept. 1, Olympic marathon runner Rebecca Cheptegei was preparing to go to church from her home in the highlands of western Kenya. Her ex-boyfriend called a friend of his to ask if he could borrow a lighter.
articles.title: Olympic runner Cheptegei defied her violent ex. She lost her life anyway

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iraqi oil minister Hayan Abdel-Ghani is in stable condition after receiving emergency heart surgery during an official visit to the United States, an oil ministry official who is part of the Iraqi delegation said on Saturday.
articles.title: Iraqi oil minister stable after surgery in US, official says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia and Ukraine conducted a major exchange of prisoners on Saturday, 206 in all, in their second such swap in two days, following negotiations mediated by the United Arab Emirates, officials said.
articles.title: Russia, Ukraine exchange 206 prisoners in second swap in two days
